title: (x) 1946 Notorious movie poster - hand lettered (similar to Radiant) {Mike Y}
content: Can anyone help me identify this all cap type from a Hitchcock movie poster (1946): ![Notorious](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26360.jpg)
author: suzscott

comments.content: That was probably done by hand.

I agree. Identical letters are not identical.   
   
However, I will look to see if it resembles a typeface from that era.
Ooops! I thought I cancelled that first post. Yves, you have your eraser handy?

Hm, interesting.. I dug up another version, quite a sloppy job:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26363.jpg)

It resembles Radiant in some of its Photo-Lettering forms, but that's about as close as I could find for thick-thin sans (as Photo-Lettering called them).   
   
At least a few forms still live as digital fonts, such as the [PL version from Agfa](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142647/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=AG61706201P1) seen here at Phil's Fonts.

The Red Rooster version of [Radiant](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142647/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=RR00010004P2) has the right A, but wrong R (which can be found in the Alternate face from RR)

What would be a good common digital typeface I could start with and alter a bit? (This is just for a school project.)   
   
Thanks for your help!
